title: James Cracknell's ex-wife Beverley Turner admits she's happy he's found love with new girlfriend
text:
Beverley Turner has admitted it's been tough reaching an amicable relationship with her ex husband James Cracknell.

The TV presenter, 45, has said that while the ex couple are now on good terms for the sake of the three children they share, there are 'days when you really want to hire an assassin to take each other out'.

Speaking on ITV's Lorraine on Monday, Beverly explained though that she's happy both she and James have moved on with new partners.

Parting ways: Beverley Turner has admitted it's been tough reaching an amicable relationship with her ex husband James Cracknell (pictured in October 2017)

Beverley and James divorced in March, revealing they had split last year after 17 years of marriage. The pair share son Croyde, 16 and two daughters, Kili, 10, and eight-year-old Trixie.

The star insists that while they have a rollercoaster relationship, their kids are always their priority.

'We’ve got three children. Our eldest is 16 and the girls are 8 and 10. That’s very demanding and you have to remain amicable for the sake of the children.'

'Even if on days when you really just want to hire an assassin and take each other out. Which I think, anybody getting divorced, you do have those days, course you do.'

Candid: Speaking on Monday's Lorraine Beverley, 45, said that while the exes are now on good terms for the sake of their children, there are 'days when you really want to hire an assassin'

'But we know, bigger picture, the children are more important than anything.'

Their marriage broke down in the years following James' devastating brain injury in 2000.

James suffered terrible head injuries when he was hit by the wing mirror of a truck while cycling across America. The damage to the frontal lobe of his brain affected his personality, with Beverley explaining:

'He was very different,' adding though that she's amazed by his recovery. 'He’s come an incredibly long way in that period of time.'

'It culminated in him going to university and getting his Masters.' It was while studying for his Masters at Cambridge that James met new girlfriend American financier Jordan Connell.

Family: Beverley and James divorced in March after 17 years of marriage, and while they have a rollercoaster relationship, their kids are always their priority Beverley explained

Jordan, who is in her early 30s, spent 12 months studying for an MBA at the prestigious university before returning to her native city of New York.

She is now understood to split her time between London and the US, and was seen supporting James during his ill-fated stint on Strictly last month.

Beverley pointed out that it's positive that James has met someone new who didn't know him before his injury.

'The great thing is that he’s met somebody who didn’t know him before the accident,' she told Lorraine.

Still friends: The TV presenter added that she's happy the sportsman, 47, has found love again with a new girlfriend

'[If you knew him before] you’re constantly looking for the first person. You see differences. If you didn’t know him before, you’d probably think he was perfectly normal. But scruffy and clearly can’t dance, you wouldn’t necessarily think, that’s a guy with a brain injury.'

Beverley added that James, who was the first celeb to be voted off Strictly last month, has always suffered from low self-esteem, explaining: 'I’ve always said, show me a room of Olympic gold medallists and I’ll show you a room of people with very low self-esteem. I love watching sport but those individuals are not necessarily easy to live with, whether they’re male or female.'

'That single-mindedness determination can be a wonderful thing but it can also mean you’re sat on your own on a beach for three hours. I didn’t want to live that life anymore. We weren’t setting a good example for the kids on what a relationship should look like.'

New love: James has been dating American financier Jordan after meeting during their studies at Cambridge University

Beverley has also moved on from the marriage and is currently dating James Pritchett, a 31-year-old eco-housing property developer.

The couple, who recently attended Chris Evans' Carfest event, were introduced by mutual friends and have been on several dates over the last two months.

'It's early days, younger man, what’s not to like?' she teased. 'One of the challenges as a divorced woman is finding time for everything. We’re left sorting out the P.E kits and swimming bags and who needs to be where. Having a relationship in that environment is really challenging.'

'I have to say, ‘I can’t be around’ and he’s unbelievably understanding. He said, ‘I always knew you came as a package of four’.'She added: 'If I can fit some fun in my week, so much the better.'
description: Beverley Turner has admitted it's been tough reaching an amicable relationship with her ex husband James Cracknell.
